did.unittitle: Albert Cornell, M.D. collection of medical ephemera
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: Retired Chief of the Gastrointestinal Clinic at Mount Sinai Hospital.
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Albert Cornell, M.D. Collection of Medical Ephemera, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Albert Cornell, M.D. Collection of Medical Ephemera was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2006.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dr. Cornell was a consultant in gastroenterology at the Mount Sinai Medical Center and the retired Chief of the Gastrointestinal Clinic at Mount Sinai Hospital.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of medical and pharmaceutical advertisements and promotional materials. Included are posters, booklets, diet guides, recipe books, artifacts (coffee mugs, paperweights, etc.) and other promotional ephemera. Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Advertising, Sales & Marketing History.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Related materials may be found in the following Hartman Center collections:

extref.emph: Roy Lightner Collection of Antique Advertisements

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Accessions described in this finding aid: 2006-0094
